title: Chinese Stocks Rally in Hong Kong After Beijing Cuts Key Rates
sub_head: Shares of developers gain after central bank lowers mortgage-lending benchmark
body:
Chinese stocks listed in Hong Kong jumped, with rate cuts by China’s central bank sparking a strong rally in the shares of companies from property developers to the country’s internet giants.
On Thursday, the Hang Seng Index rose 3.4%, taking its 2022 year-to-date gain to 6.6%. The benchmark turned in its worst performance in a decade last year, as global investors dumped stocks in industries that were targeted by Beijing’s regulatory actions and stricter rules.
